 66
 67/// Perform a forward FFT.
 68int const fft_fwd = -2;
 69/// Perform an inverse FFT.
 70int const fft_inv = -1;

 84/// These numbers are 'number-of-times' constants as they
 85/// map to FFTW planning strategies. We list them here since
 86/// they are used outside the FFTW backend, too (CVSIP).
 87///
 88/// number-of-times >= 32 or 0 (infinity)... patient
 89/// number-of-times >= 12 .................. measure
 90/// else ................................... estimate
 91enum fftw_planning { estimate=1, measure=12, patient=32};
 92
 93/// The list of evaluators to be tried, in that specific order.
 94typedef Make_type_list<
 95#ifdef VSIP_IMPL_CUDA_FFT
 96  Cuda_tag,
 97#endif
 98#ifdef VSIP_IMPL_CBE_SDK_FFT
 99  Cbe_sdk_tag,
100#endif
101#if VSIP_IMPL_SAL_FFT
102  Mercury_sal_tag,
103#endif
104#if VSIP_IMPL_IPP_FFT
105  Intel_ipp_tag,
106#endif
107#if VSIP_IMPL_FFTW3
108  Fftw3_tag,
109#endif
110#if VSIP_IMPL_CVSIP_FFT
111  Cvsip_tag,
112#endif
113#if VSIP_IMPL_DFT_FFT
114  DFT_tag,
115#endif
116#if VSIP_IMPL_NO_FFT
117  No_FFT_tag,
118#endif
119  None_type
120  >::type LibraryTagList;
121
122template <dimension_type D, typename I, typename O, int A, int E>
123class base_interface
124  : public profile::Accumulator<profile::signal>
125{
126  typedef profile::Accumulator<profile::signal> accumulator_type;
127public:
128  static dimension_type const dim = D;
129  typedef typename impl::Scalar_of<I>::type scalar_type;
130
131  base_interface(Domain<D> const &dom, scalar_type scale, 
132    bool is_fftm, int dir, return_mechanism_type rm)
133    : accumulator_type(Description<D, I, O>::tag(is_fftm, dom, dir, rm, A),
134                       is_fftm ?
135                       (A == 1 ?
136                        // row-wise Fftm
137                        dom[0].size() * Op_count<I, O>::value
138                        (io_size<1, O, I, 0>::size(dom[1]).size()) :
139                        // column-wise Fftm
140                        dom[1].size() * Op_count<I, O>::value
141                        (io_size<1, O, I, 0>::size(dom[0]).size())) :
142                       // ! is_fftm
143                       Op_count<I, O>::value
144                       (io_size<D, O, I, A>::size(dom).size())),
145      input_size_(io_size<D, I, O, A>::size(dom)),
146      output_size_(io_size<D, O, I, A>::size(dom)),
147      scale_(scale)
148  {}
149
150  /// Returns a Domain<> object with first index set to :literal:`0`,
151  /// stride set to :literal:`1`, and size reflecting the appropriate
152  /// input view size for this :literal:`Fft` object.
153  Domain<dim> const& 
154  input_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW 
155  { return this->input_size_;}
156  
157  /// Returns a Domain<> object with first index set to :literal:`0`,
158  /// stride set to :literal:`1`, and size reflecting the appropriate
159  /// output view size for this :literal:`Fft` object.
160  Domain<dim> const& 
161  output_size() const VSIP_NOTHROW 
162  { return this->output_size_;}
163  
164  /// Returns the scale factor used in this :literal:`Fft` object.
165  scalar_type 
166  scale() const VSIP_NOTHROW 
167  { return this->scale_;}
168  
169  /// Returns :literal:`true` if this is a forward Fast Fourier Transformation.
170  bool 
171  forward() const VSIP_NOTHROW
172  { return E == -1;}
173  
174  float impl_performance(char const *what) const
175  {
176    if      (!strcmp(what, "mops")) return this->mops();
177    else if (!strcmp(what, "time")) return this->total();
178    else if (!strcmp(what, "count")) return this->count();
179    else return 0.f;
180  }
181
182protected:
183  Domain<dim> input_size_;
184  Domain<dim> output_size_;
185  scalar_type scale_;
186};
187
188} // namespace vsip::impl::fft
189
190template <dimension_type D,                      //< Dimension
191	  typename I,                            //< Input type
192	  typename O,                            //< Output type
193	  typename L,                            //< LibraryTagList
194	  int S = 0,                             //< Special dimension
195	  return_mechanism_type = by_value,      //< Return mechanism
196	  unsigned N = 0,                        //< Number of times
197	  alg_hint_type = alg_time>              //< algorithm Hint
198class fft_facade;
199
200template <dimension_type D,
201	  typename I,
202	  typename O,
203	  typename L,
204	  int S,
205	  unsigned N,
206	  alg_hint_type H>
207class fft_facade<D, I, O, L, S, by_value, N, H>
208  : public fft::base_interface<D, I, O,
209			       fft::axis<I, O, S>::value,
210			       fft::exponent<I, O, S>::value>
211{
212public:
213  static int const axis = fft::axis<I, O, S>::value;
214  static int const exponent = fft::exponent<I, O, S>::value;
215  typedef fft::base_interface<D, I, O, axis, exponent> base;
216#if VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
217  typedef fft::Ct_workspace<D, I, O> workspace;
218#else
219  typedef fft::workspace<D, I, O> workspace;
220#endif
221  typedef fft::factory<D, I, O, S, by_value, N, L> factory;
222
223  fft_facade(Domain<D> const& dom, typename base::scalar_type scale)
224    VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
225    : base(dom, scale, false, S, by_value),
226#ifdef VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
227      backend_(cvsip::create<fft::backend<D, I, O, axis, exponent> >
228               (dom, scale, N)),
229#else
230      backend_(factory::create(dom, scale)),
231#endif
232      workspace_(backend_.get(), this->input_size(), this->output_size(), scale)
233  {}
234
235#ifdef VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
236  /// Returns the Fast Fourier Transform of :literal:`in`.
237  template <typename ViewT>
238  typename fft::result<O, typename ViewT::block_type>::view_type
239  operator()(ViewT in) VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
240  {
241    typename base::Scope scope(*this);
242    assert(extent(in) == extent(this->input_size()));
243    typedef fft::result<O, typename ViewT::block_type> traits;
244    typename traits::view_type out(traits::create(this->output_size(),
245                                                 in.block().map()));
246    workspace_.by_reference(this->backend_.get(), in, out);
247    return out;
248  }
249#else
250  /// Returns the Fast Fourier Transform of :literal:`in`.
251  template <typename ViewT>
252  typename fft::Result_rbo<D, I, O, ViewT, workspace, axis, exponent>
253                          ::view_type
254  operator()(ViewT in) VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
255  {
256    typename base::Scope scope(*this);
257    assert(extent(in) == extent(this->input_size()));
258    typedef fft::Result_rbo<D, I, O, ViewT, workspace, axis, exponent>
259      traits;
260    typedef typename traits::functor_type functor_type;
261    typedef typename traits::block_type   block_type;
262    typedef typename traits::view_type    view_type;
263
264    functor_type rf(in, this->output_size(), *(this->backend_.get()),
265		    workspace_);
266    block_type block(rf);
267    return view_type(block);
268  }
269#endif
270  friend class vsip::impl::diag_detail::Diagnose_fft;
271private:
272  std::auto_ptr<fft::backend<D, I, O, axis, exponent> > backend_;
273  workspace workspace_;
274};
275
276template <dimension_type D,
277	  typename I,
278	  typename O,
279	  typename L,
280	  int S,
281	  unsigned N,
282	  alg_hint_type H>
283class fft_facade<D, I, O, L, S, vsip::by_reference, N, H>
284  : public fft::base_interface<D, I, O,
285			       fft::axis<I, O, S>::value,
286			       fft::exponent<I, O, S>::value>
287{
288public:
289  static int const axis = fft::axis<I, O, S>::value;
290  static int const exponent = fft::exponent<I, O, S>::value;
291  typedef fft::base_interface<D, I, O, axis, exponent> base;
292#if VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
293  typedef fft::Ct_workspace<D, I, O> workspace;
294#else
295  typedef fft::workspace<D, I, O> workspace;
296#endif
297  typedef fft::factory<D, I, O, S, vsip::by_reference, N, L> factory;
298
299  fft_facade(Domain<D> const& dom, typename base::scalar_type scale)
300    VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
301    : base(dom, scale, false, S, by_reference),
302#ifdef VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
303      backend_(cvsip::create<fft::backend<D, I, O, axis, exponent> >
304               (dom, scale, N)),
305#else
306      backend_(factory::create(dom, scale)),
307#endif
308      workspace_(backend_.get(), this->input_size(), this->output_size(), scale)
309  {}
310
311  /// Computes the Fast Fourier Transform of :literal:`in` and stores the result
312  /// in :literal:`out`.
313  template <typename Block0, typename Block1,
314 	    template <typename, typename> class View0,
315 	    template <typename, typename> class View1>
316  View1<O,Block1>
317  operator()(View0<I,Block0> in, View1<O,Block1> out)
318    VSIP_NOTHROW
319  {
320    typename base::Scope scope(*this);
321    VSIP_IMPL_STATIC_ASSERT((View0<I,Block0>::dim == View1<O,Block1>::dim));
322    assert(extent(in) == extent(this->input_size()));
323    assert(extent(out) == extent(this->output_size()));
324    workspace_.by_reference(this->backend_.get(), in, out);
325    return out;
326  }
327
328  /// Computes the Fast Fourier Transform of :literal:`inout` in place.
329  template <typename BlockT, template <typename, typename> class View>
330  View<I,BlockT>
331  operator()(View<I,BlockT> inout) VSIP_NOTHROW
332  {
333    typename base::Scope scope(*this);
334    assert(extent(inout) == extent(this->input_size()));
335    assert(extent(inout) == extent(this->output_size()));
336    workspace_.in_place(this->backend_.get(), inout);
337    return inout;
338  }
339
340  friend class vsip::impl::diag_detail::Diagnose_fft;
341private:
342  std::auto_ptr<impl::fft::backend<D, I, O, axis, exponent> > backend_;
343  workspace workspace_;
344};
345
346template <typename I,                       //< Input type
347	  typename O,                       //< Output type
348	  typename L,                       //< Library type-list
349	  int A,                            //< Axis
350	  int D,                            //< Direction
351	  return_mechanism_type,            //< Return mechanism
352	  unsigned N = 0,                   //< Number of times
353	  alg_hint_type = alg_time>         //< algorithm Hint
354class fftm_facade;
355
356template <typename I,
357	  typename O,
358	  typename L,
359	  int A,
360	  int D,
361	  unsigned N,
362	  alg_hint_type H>
363class fftm_facade<I, O, L, A, D, by_value, N, H>
364  : public fft::base_interface<2, I, O, A, D == -2 ? -1 : 1>
365{
366  static int const axis = A;
367  static int const exponent = D == -2 ? -1 : 1;
368  typedef fft::base_interface<2, I, O, axis, exponent> base;
369#if VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
370  typedef fft::Ct_workspace<2, I, O> workspace;
371#else
372  typedef fft::workspace<2, I, O> workspace;
373#endif
374  typedef fftm::factory<I, O, axis, exponent, by_value, N, L> factory;
375public:
376  fftm_facade(Domain<2> const& dom, typename base::scalar_type scale)
377    VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
378    : base(dom, scale, true, D, by_value),
379#ifdef VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
380      backend_(cvsip::create<fft::fftm<I, O, axis, exponent> > (dom, scale, N)),
381#else
382      backend_(factory::create(dom, scale)),
383#endif
384      workspace_(backend_.get(), this->input_size(), this->output_size(), scale)
385  {}
386
387#ifdef VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
388  /// Returns the Fast Fourier Transform of :literal:`in`.
389  template <typename BlockT>
390  typename fft::result<O,BlockT>::view_type
391  operator()(const_Matrix<I,BlockT> in)
392     VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
393  {
394    typename base::Scope scope(*this);
395    typedef fft::result<O,BlockT> traits;
396    typename traits::view_type out(traits::create(this->output_size(),
397                                                 in.block().map()));
398    assert(extent(in) == extent(this->input_size()));
399    if (Is_global_map<typename BlockT::map_type>::value &&
400        in.block().map().num_subblocks(A) != 1)
401      VSIP_IMPL_THROW(unimplemented(
402        "Fftm requires dimension along FFT to not be distributed"));
403    workspace_.by_reference(this->backend_.get(), in.local(), out.local());
404    return out;
405  }
406#else
407  /// Returns the Fast Fourier Transform of :literal:`in`.
408  template <typename BlockT>  
409  typename fft::Result_fftm_rbo<I, O, BlockT, workspace, axis, exponent>
410                          ::view_type
411  operator()(const_Matrix<I,BlockT> in)
412    VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
413  {
414    typename base::Scope scope(*this);
415    assert(extent(in) == extent(this->input_size()));
416
417    /* TODO: Return_blocks don't have a valid map() yet
418    if (Is_global_map<typename BlockT::map_type>::value &&
419	in.block().map().num_subblocks(A) != 1)
420      VSIP_IMPL_THROW(unimplemented(
421	"Fftm requires dimension along FFT to not be distributed"));
422    */
423
424    typedef fft::Result_fftm_rbo<I, O, BlockT, workspace, axis, exponent>
425      traits;
426    typedef typename traits::functor_type functor_type;
427    typedef typename traits::block_type   block_type;
428    typedef typename traits::view_type    view_type;
429
430    functor_type rf(in, this->output_size(), *(this->backend_.get()),
431		    workspace_);
432    block_type block(rf);
433    return view_type(block);
434 }
435#endif
436
437  friend class vsip::impl::diag_detail::Diagnose_fftm;
438private:
439  std::auto_ptr<typename fft::fftm<I, O, axis, exponent> > backend_;
440  workspace workspace_;
441};
442
443template <typename I,
444	  typename O,
445	  typename L,
446	  int A,
447	  int D,
448	  unsigned N,
449	  alg_hint_type H>
450class fftm_facade<I, O, L, A, D, vsip::by_reference, N, H>
451  : public fft::base_interface<2, I, O, A, D == -2 ? -1 : 1>
452{
453  static int const axis = A;
454  static int const exponent = D == -2 ? -1 : 1;
455  typedef fft::base_interface<2, I, O, axis, exponent> base;
456#if VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
457  typedef fft::Ct_workspace<2, I, O> workspace;
458#else
459  typedef fft::workspace<2, I, O> workspace;
460#endif
461  typedef fftm::factory<I, O, axis, exponent, by_value, N, L> factory;
462public:
463  fftm_facade(Domain<2> const& dom, typename base::scalar_type scale)
464    VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
465    : base(dom, scale, true, D, by_reference),
466#ifdef VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
467      backend_(cvsip::create<fft::fftm<I, O, axis, exponent> > (dom, scale, N)),
468#else
469      backend_(factory::create(dom, scale)),
470#endif
471      workspace_(backend_.get(), this->input_size(), this->output_size(), scale)
472  {}
473
474  /// Computes the Fast Fourier Transform of :literal:`in` and stores the result
475  /// in :literal:`out`.
476  template <typename Block0, typename Block1>
477  Matrix<O,Block1>
478  operator()(const_Matrix<I,Block0> in, Matrix<O,Block1> out)
479    VSIP_NOTHROW
480  {
481    typename base::Scope scope(*this);
482    assert(extent(in)  == extent(this->input_size()));
483    assert(extent(out) == extent(this->output_size()));
484    if (Is_global_map<typename Block0::map_type>::value ||
485	Is_global_map<typename Block1::map_type>::value)
486    {
487      if (in.block().map().num_subblocks(A) != 1 ||
488	  out.block().map().num_subblocks(A) != 1)
489	VSIP_IMPL_THROW(unimplemented(
490	  "Fftm requires dimension along FFT to not be distributed"));
491      if (global_domain(in) != global_domain(out))
492	VSIP_IMPL_THROW(unimplemented(
493	  "Fftm requires input and output to have same mapping"));
494    }
495    workspace_.by_reference(this->backend_.get(), in.local(), out.local());
496    return out;
497  }
498
499  /// Computes the Fast Fourier Transform of :literal:`inout` in place.
500  template <typename BlockT>
501  Matrix<O,BlockT>
502  operator()(Matrix<O,BlockT> inout) VSIP_NOTHROW
503  {
504    typename base::Scope scope(*this);
505    assert(extent(inout) == extent(this->input_size()));
506    if (Is_global_map<typename BlockT::map_type>::value &&
507	inout.block().map().num_subblocks(A) != 1)
508      VSIP_IMPL_THROW(unimplemented(
509	"Fftm requires dimension along FFT to not be distributed"));
510    workspace_.in_place(this->backend_.get(), inout.local());
511    return inout;
512  }
513
514  friend class vsip::impl::diag_detail::Diagnose_fftm;
515private:
516  std::auto_ptr<typename fft::fftm<I, O, axis, exponent> > backend_;
517  workspace workspace_;
518};
519
520} // namespace vsip::impl
521
522/// FFT operation type.
523/// Applying an FFT object on a view performs a single Fast Fourier Transform
524/// on the entire view. :literal:`Fft` supports different computations, dependent
525/// on the  input element type, output element type, a specified direction or a 
526/// *special dimension*, and the dimensionalities of the input and output views.
527///
528/// Template parameters:
529///   :V: View (:literal:`const_Vector` for 1D FFTs, :literal:`const_Matrix` for
530///       2D FFTs, :literal:`const_Tensor` for 3D FFTs)
531///   :I: Input type
532///   :O: Output type
533///   :S: Special Dimension
534///   :return_mechanism_type: one of :literal:`by_value` or :literal:`by_reference`
535///   :N: Anticipated number of times this object will be used.
536///   :H: This value indicates how the implementation should optimize its
537///       computation or resource use.
538///
539/// +-----+-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
540/// | dim | I / O                   | S       | input size             | output size       |
541/// +=====+=========================+=========+========================+===================+
542/// | 1D  | complex<T> / complex<T> | fft_fwd | M                      | M                 |
543/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
544/// |     | complex<T> / complex<T> | fft_inv | M                      | M                 |
545/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
546/// |     | T / complex<T>          | 0       | M                      | M/2 + 1           |
547/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
548/// |     | complex<T> / T          | 0       | M/2 + 1                | M                 |
549/// +-----+-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
550/// | 2D  | complex<T> / complex<T> | fft_fwd | M x N                  | M x N             |
551/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
552/// |     | complex<T> / complex<T> | fft_inv | M x N                  | M x N             |
553/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
554/// |     | T / complex<T>          | 0       | M x N                  | (M/2 + 1) x N     |
555/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
556/// |     | T / complex<T>          | 1       | M x N                  | M x (N/2 + 1)     |
557/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
558/// |     | complex<T> / T          | 0       | (M/2 + 1) x N          | M x N             |
559/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
560/// |     | complex<T> / T          | 1       | M x (N/2 + 1)          | M x N             |
561/// +-----+-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
562/// | 3D  | complex<T> / complex<T> | fft_fwd | M x N x P              | M x N x P         |
563/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
564/// |     | complex<T> / complex<T> | fft_inv | M x N x P              | M x N x P         |
565/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
566/// |     | T / complex<T>          | 0       | M x N x P              | (M/2 + 1) x N x P |
567/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
568/// |     | T / complex<T>          | 1       | M x N x P              | M x (N/2 + 1) x P |
569/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
570/// |     | T / complex<T>          | 2       | M x N x P              | M x N x (P/2 + 1) |
571/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
572/// |     | complex<T> / T          | 0       | (M/2 + 1) x N x P      | M x N x P         |
573/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
574/// |     | complex<T> / T          | 1       | M x (N/2 + 1) x P      | M x N x P         |
575/// |     +-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
576/// |     | complex<T> / T          | 2       | M x N x (P/2 + 1)      | M x N x P         |
577/// +-----+-------------------------+---------+------------------------+-------------------+
578template <template <typename, typename> class V,
579	  typename I,
580	  typename O,
581	  int S = 0,
582	  return_mechanism_type R = by_value,
583	  unsigned N = 0,
584	  alg_hint_type H = alg_time>
585class Fft : public impl::fft_facade<impl::Dim_of_view<V>::dim,
586				    I, O, impl::fft::LibraryTagList,
587				    S, R, N, H>
588{
589  static dimension_type const dim = impl::Dim_of_view<V>::dim;
590  typedef impl::fft_facade<dim, I, O, impl::fft::LibraryTagList,
591			   S, R, N, H> base;
592public:
593  /// Create an :literal:`Fft` object.
594  ///
595  /// Arguments:
596  ///   :dom:   The domain of the view to be operated on.
597  ///   :scale: A scalar factor to be applied to the result.
598  Fft(Domain<dim> const& dom, typename base::scalar_type scale)
599    VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc)) 
600    : base(dom, scale) {}
601};
602
603/// FFTM operation type.
604/// Applying an FFTM object on a matrix performs one Fast Fourier Transform
605/// per row or column, depending on its orientation. As :literal:`Fft`, it
606/// supports different computations, dependent on the  input element type and
607/// output element type.
608///
609/// Template parameters:
610///   :I: Input type
611///   :O: Output type
612///   :A: Orientation: one of :literal:`row` and :literal:`col`
613///   :D: Direction: one of :literal:`fft_fwd` and :literal:`fft_inv`
614///   :return_mechanism_type: one of :literal:`by_value` or :literal:`by_reference`
615///   :N: Anticipated number of times this object will be used.
616///   :H: This value indicates how the implementation should optimize its
617///       computation or resource use.
618///
619/// +-------------------------+-----+-----------------+---------------+---------------+
620/// | I / O                   | A   | D               | input size    | output size   |
621/// +=========================+=====+=================+===============+===============+
622/// | complex<T> / complex<T> | 0,1 | fft_fwd,fft_inv | N x M         | N x M         |
623/// +-------------------------+-----+-----------------+---------------+---------------+
624/// | T / complex<T>          | 0   | fft_fwd         | N x M         | N x (M/2 + 1) |
625/// +-------------------------+-----+-----------------+---------------+---------------+
626/// | T / complex<T>          | 1   | fft_fwd         | N x M         | (N/2 + 1) x M |
627/// +-------------------------+-----+-----------------+---------------+---------------+
628/// | complex<T> / T          | 0   | fft_inv         | N x (M/2 + 1) | N x M         |
629/// +-------------------------+-----+-----------------+---------------+---------------+
630/// | complex<T> / T          | 1   | fft_inv         | (N/2 + 1) x M | N x M         |
631/// +-------------------------+-----+-----------------+---------------+---------------+
632template <typename I,
633	  typename O,
634	  int A = row,
635	  int D = fft_fwd,
636	  return_mechanism_type R = by_value,
637	  unsigned N = 0,
638	  alg_hint_type H = alg_time>
639class Fftm : public impl::fftm_facade<I, O, impl::fft::LibraryTagList,
640				      1 - A, D, R, N, H> 
641{
642  // Fftm and 2D Fft share some underlying logic.
643  // The 'Special dimension' (S) template parameter in 2D Fft uses '0' to
644  // represent column-first and '1' for a row-first transformation, while
645  // the Fftm 'Axis' (A) parameter uses '0' to represent row-wise, and
646  // '1' for column-wise transformation.
647  // Thus, by using '1 - A' here we can share the implementation, too.
648  typedef impl::fftm_facade<I, O, impl::fft::LibraryTagList,
649			    1 - A, D, R, N, H> base;
650public:
651  /// Create an :literal:`Fftm` object.
652  ///
653  /// Arguments:
654  ///   :dom: The domain of the matrix to be operated on.
655  ///   :scale: A scalar factor to be applied to the result.
656  Fftm(Domain<2> const& dom, typename base::scalar_type scale)
657    VSIP_THROW((std::bad_alloc))
658    : base(dom, scale) {}
659};
660
661} // namespace vsip
662
663#endif // VSIP_IMPL_FFT_HPP
